google_play_reviews.content: Error message everytime on android phone.

With newer Android versions the app is totally unusable because lacking the possibility to read WIG cassette files from phone folderes. I looka the only WIG app for the Android and correction is needed ASAP!!!

The app is a bit janky, but I was able to complete a wherigo using it. It is obviously outdated but does it's job. If it's not recognizing cartridges in the file you specified, go to settings. Then click Apps/wheryougo/set as default. Click supported web addresses, and enable both. Hope this helps.

Doesn't see cartriges in phone storage because it's missing some permissions that are new in Android 12+, luckily it will work if you put the .gwc into ./Android/Data/menion.android.whereyou/files. The app needs some updates, the UI is also very outdated, but I'm not surprised that no one develops it since groundpeak itself kinda abandoned WhereIGo.
Plain doesn't work. I've tried this app on multiple phones, renamed files, changed folder settings, etc. Just doesn't work.

Has issues for years with folder management and finding cartridges. It seems not to find cartridges if you change the set folder. Since android 11 you cant access the standard fder. The workaround to open it via cgeo or directly via link in whereyougo dont work (anymore) as it automatically downloads it instead of opening it directly. In other words, unusable for any tipe of "modern" device. Googling it, it seems like this issue is known for around 4 years?
It doesn't seem to work. Error when I try to download cartridge
Won't work anymore.
Google pixel. It was working, but now doesn't see cartridges and I can't move them to the default directory (hidden)
tried every thing to get it to work on my phone and even an expert failed
Pretty useless really the program cannot find the GWC file even when I created the correct file path and I don't have access to a PC so this app is useless to me and others reading previous comments.
Use Geooh Go instead, the 5.99 is worth it

This app used to work on this phone but after I had to delete all the data and reload, I cannot get whereIgo to work properly. If you're going to use external files as a part of your app, you better make sure you can actually open the files. One of the warnings is that it must be able to write to your storage and of course I do have my cartridge in the correct location. Strangely, the whereIgo app will actually write an error message to my storage folder. But will it find its file? No!
Na toll, nach der letzten Aktualisierung gehts nicht mehr. Muss man immer alles verschlimmbessern???
This thing is a mess. Can't access cartridges at all on Android. I used it recently so may be a problem with latest version.

Doesn't work on Android 12, doesn't matter what cartridge location I select, the app won't see the file to open it. The file is there and accessible from file browsers. App has all the necessary permissions. The only solution seems to be to use default location only, which is normally inaccessible to place the cartridge into by other mobile apps due to security, so I had to copy the file into this folder via PC... Now it opened. You gotta resolve the newer Android versions issues.
could not get it to work on pixel 6......disappointing
A good app for WIG.
App is broken. Can't find gwc files
Cannot get this to function, tried everything that was suggested by other users. As like the last few reviewers, running Android 13, can download the files, but the app cannot find them.
I couldn't get this app to work at all. It wouldn't recognise the .gwc files I had downloaded, despite them being in the correct folders, and I just found it generally confusing to use. :(
Samsung Galaxy A13 here. Running Android 13. App won't even open. It gets to the loading screen and then immediately crashes

Great when it worked. Despite changing the folder it still shows as being in an storage/emulated/downloads.... If I click to change again, it starts me where I changed it to but doesn't see any .gwc files in it.google pixel 6

Very tough, but occasionally possible, to load files on Galaxy S22. Go to phone settings, then Apps, then Whereyougo, and under Set as default, enable links to supported web addresses. Then in whereyougo app settings, set up login credentials. Find a whereigo cache in a Geocaching app, and when you click on link, it should launch the download dialog from the whereyougo app. I have them going to my Download directory. Unfortunately, sometimes there's an unknown download error. Annoying

I've always used this app. The latest update has prevented me from enjoying the app as it does not recognize the file that it uses and doesn't send to it whereyouapp like it used to. Is there a solution for this fix or being solved to work on the andriod phone?
Would not open cartridges on my Pixel 7 pro, despite everything being in the correct filepath.
This does not work at all on my Android Google Pixel 7. It just beeps really loud.
This doesn't work

Crashed 30 waypoints into a 40 waypoint cache and couldn't recover my data. Upwards of three hours of my life gone. Man I'm not even angry I'm just exhausted by this app. GPS is spotty nearly all the time and takes ages to find the waypoints. App feels antiquated. This is exhausting.

Does not work for Android. The phone does not recognize the file. When trying to open the cartridge, it says there are no cartridges downloaded when there are and when trying to open open the download, it says that I dont have any application to open the cartridge with even though I have the App installed. Useless.
Doesn't seem to work with Android any more. Additionally, data access restrictions on Android make it nearlyimpossible to even get the files to the right places. It was a good while it lasted
Don't work
Somehow it does not recognise the Cartridges. I tried multiple different things but I could not fix it.
Does the developer even address these problems. I'm having the same problem all the one stars are having. Developer??? Are you gonna ever fix this??

Lars (of c:geo support) was extremely helpful and patient sorting out the file folder issue in my Android 12. Some helpful screenshots were shared via email. Now whereyougo works again with newer phone. He save me from subscribing to another app. Thanks
On hour number three trying to figure out how I get a downloaded cartridge into my phone

I am a WheriGo game developer and this worked nicely on my Android Note. Specified game file location does not even exist on my Samsung S5 (Marshmallow ). I have kept trying this APP, and it has improved significantly since my first encounter in 2016. Retargeting the default directory is still a pain. Maybe it is more a applause to Smartphone power & advancement over time; but using it in 2022 is quite enjoyable.

I originally gave this a 4 out of 5 only b/c it created an OWS instead of a GWS file which meant it would never unlock the cartridge at the end, but now it just plain does NOT work at all :( it glitches and keeps cycling through, the web address it gives to report the problem is invalid. :( too bad b/c I used to love doing the WIGs
Download: Error Cant download cartridges
Used to be a great app, but now wont see any .gwc files which makes it useless
Doesn't recognize cartifges utterly useless
Doesn't work. The so has permissions to the folders but it doesn't detect the cartridge. Pretty sad. Zero stars of i could. The rest seems pretty bare bones. Is this still in testing?

Every whereigo experience has been disappointing. I decided to give it another go today. After walking several hundred metres, the app shows an illegal Pointer operation and becomes. Even if it was working flawlessly, the interface is so bad ( feels like Windows CE all over again) that the experience is negative no matter what.
Havent really gotten into it much but fun so far
Didn't work at all. Couldn't get it to load a single thing. Followed all instructions and have spent over 2hrs fiddling now nothing works

This app used to work fine on my Motorola G-Power. After some recent update, however, the app can no longer find the WIG cartridges on my phone; it complains, "No Wherigo cartridge (*.gwc) is available..." I have double-checked the directory and the cartridge files are still there. I have cleared the cache, deleted & reinstalled the app, and still this error. Yes, the app does have permission to access media, just as always. Am I alone with this problem? Update: MONTHS have passed without a fix
Was really keen to try this but it keeps saying there are no cartridges installed even after downloading them from the website and checking the file location in app :\

UPDATE : July 2022 Have to change my rating. I know how how this app works. But for some reason it no longer recognizes GWC files. It does take some configuration, but once you change up the folder where you store the whereigo files, this app runs smooth! It really depends on what android device you have, but I recommend making the folder where you access your whereigo files your download folder so they're right there

I have only ever managed to complete one wherigo several years ago. Have attempted others but app freezes. Have uninstalled & reinstalled several times. Now I find the initial page is all in a language that I don't know! Uninstalling again....
The app doesn't recognize any of the wherigos I downloaded and I couldn't figure out how to move the file folders. But, I'm tired of messing with it.
Doesn't work, doesn't recognise the gwc file. Pointless
Never used it
Android v 12: The app don't recognize gwc files. My only advise: Use older Android version.
I simply cannot get the app to recognise any of the cartridges I've downloaded. Rubbish!
App won't work on S22. Hard fail.
Terrible app. It crashes more times than it works and its not intuitive at all. Too bad its the only free version for android.

This thing is worthless without turn-by-turn navigation, or at least a navigable map showing the destination relative to where I am unless all the stages are in a single cemetery or park, for example. The useless compass navigation screen doesn't even show the coordinates of the destination. It just shows my position's coordinates. And the compass is useless. All you can do is use trial and error to determine what direction decreases the distance to the target.

I was able to use the app on my android Samsung 12 after hours of fiddling with it. I used the app to find 3 caches and then the app would not recognize the .gwc files. I uninstalled and reinstalled twice and it still will not see the files. I have tried renaming, moving and redownloading the cartridges but nothing seems to work. Seems to me the developers just need to get the app to work properly.

Used to work great. Now cannot access gwc files in any folder as many others note after reinstall. Thankfully my partner has an iphone. I look forward to when this is working again and will update rating accordingly.
Doesn't work with newer androids.

I've been using WhereYouGo for years and know how its supposed to work. I just got a new device (Galaxy S22) and now the folder won't display the .gwc files. I checked my phone's internal storage and the .gwc files are in the downloads folder on my device, which I have as my target folder in the app. Tried moving the file to other folders and changing the target folder in the app, but that didn't help either. I'm certain this the correct directory as the app saw picture files in other folders.

I downloaded the app and successfully installed the cartridge I want to do. Now I am at the starting point and it shows that but won't ask me a question or tell me where to go next. Perfectly useless.
Does not work on android 12.. changing source folder and renaming files does not help 😑 it will not read *.gwc files .

I have used this app before and had no issues. Added to my new android and the program doesn't seem to see the gwc files in the source folder. I tried moving the gwc files to different folders and adjusting the source folder accordingly, but no luck. When searching the source folder I noticed that I can see jpg files, gifs, etc within the source folder but I cannot see the gwc files. I'd like to get out this spring and do some whereigo caches, hope this can be resolved.
Doesn't work at all. Cannot select the correct folder for files.
Thanks c:geo for taking over this great app, in your care I'm confident that it will go from strength to strength. I'm now looking forward to this apps future.
🛒 Downloaded Cartridges go to a folder not accessible to WhereYouGo by default.

What the heck did you guys do with the latest update!? The Whereyougo app before the update was a breeze to use. A cartridge would download straight to the APP. Now I am unable to download any Wherigo cartridges to the app. I am now looking for an alternative APP to use.

Getting there! I can now use location in Android 12 😂 What I can't do is upload cartridges to the WhereYouGo data directory under Android/Data due to new restrictions in Android 12. When I change the directory to somewhere I have stored cartridges, WhereYouGo can't find them to open. I set WhereYouGo to download cartridges directly, and it downloads and opens however later it can't find it again ..... 🤷🏼‍♂️ If I download the cartridge again, it opens along with the previous saves.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Yes, file access is still work in progress. Sorry for the inconvenience. See also here: https://www.whereyougo.org/faq#file_access

google_play_reviews.content: Stops working with Android 12. Too bad it isn't updated anymore. That leaves one remaining app to play Wherigo on Android. Edit: New update fixed it. Great, will test the update soon. Happy to hear development will pick up again.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The new update fixes the Android 12 GPS problem. Please update your app, so you can use it again. We are also now working on getting other parts of the app modernized over the next months. As there is only a small team behind, we do however need a bit of time to fix all problems.

google_play_reviews.content: I just keep getting an error notice. I've tried using Firefox and Chrome to download. Very disappointing!
App does not work for android and will not download cartridges for geocaching. Over looks like it should be an awesome app but I can't download any cartridges. Kids disappointed 😞.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
The new update fixes the login problem. Please update your app, so you can use it again.
We are also now working on getting other parts of the app modernized over the next months. As there is only a small team behind, we do however need a bit of time to fix all problems.

google_play_reviews.content: App is less then helpfully. Trying to download my first cartridge for a geocach. But all it tells me is downloading error, no path as to how to fix it

google_play_reviews.content: Works OK and you can use it to find WhereIGo caches. It's not as good as it used to be though. It has caused my phone to lockup. It isn't clear that it won't download cartridges until you enter your WhereIGo username and password. And the map no longer shows anything, so navigating using the map is pretty near useless. I did complete a WhereIGo with this app so it works, but just OK.

We are also now working on getting other parts of the app modernized over the next months. As there is only a small team behind, we do however need a bit of time to fix all problems.

google_play_reviews.content: Has this been given up on? I appreciate you guys for trying but the app hasn't been updated for over a year and I have just wasted an hour trying to get it to work. Bitterly disappointed. If you've given up can you please remove the option to install the app so nobody else wastes their time and gets their hopes up? Much appreciated.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The new update fixes many problems. Please update your app, so you can use it again. We are also now working on getting other parts of the app modernized over the next months. As there is only a small team behind, we do however need a bit of time to fix all problems.

google_play_reviews.content: This app is nowhere near as bad as the ratings would have you think. It has a few minor bugs, but if you are computer literate enough to do some stuff manually, it isn't a problem.

This barely works. When you arrive at the location there is no pop up to indicate one can enter the answer to the question. I know I've used a similar one earlier which worked much better. In addition to the above, I had to restart it at each location or if I didn't I could not continue. Lots to fix. I don't think I'll use it again in the near future but will keep an eye on it to see if the 'fix is on'.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The new update fixes many problems. Please update your app, so you can use it again. We are also now working on getting other parts of the app modernized over the next months. As there is only a small team behind, we do however need a bit of time to fix all problems.

google_play_reviews.content: This app causes my phone to constantly freeze up. More than half the time I've tried to use it, I've gotten an error message, or warning, saying it would be unsafe to continue using the app. It really is unfortunate, because I'm an avid geocacher and would love to have one more aspect of caching available to me. At this point, where I go shouldn't be part of geocaching.
Error error error, Doesn't work.
Can't use it if you've created a Geocaching account using Google authentication.
It works well and is big fun to hunt geocaches using it. Some minor fixes would be nice, but most problems people are complaining are caused by buggy cartridges.
Not working, constant popups about a NullpointerException

App works but needs some developers to pick up where the old ones left off... Quick fix to the download error is to change the default download folder (I made a new folder under my downloads folder on device and set it to that since it also seems to have issues writing to the sdcard)
Fails to download cartridges

The map is just white page with straigth line between me and next point and when wanted to see the distance to that point then had to go back to another page. App works (so, it's better than a year ago) but it's not very user friendly,
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This open source app was unmaintained over the last months. Now a new team has taken over the open source development and is just now trying to get it maintained again. Please be patient, we are working on it now!

google_play_reviews.content: Can't get any cartridges download into folder or to be recognized on phone. 😠 Still unable to get to work properly 😔
Doesn't work at all.

Works pretty well, short of some initial problems with downloading cartridges. IF YOU CANNOT DOWNLOAD A CARTRIDGE: check that the download folder is one where you have a permission to write. This folder can be set in settings/global. When I installed the app, this was set to some folder inside the top-level Android folder (I think) and cartridge download kept failing. Then I have changed it to a new top-level folder (thus a sibling of the Android folder) and now it works fine.
won't let me download the cartridges

Unusable on Android. I try to download a cartridge and just get a nonspecific "Download Error" so I can't do anything whatsoever with it. I tried it on my new phone and also an old one, both Android, and I get the same error. This app is clunky to put it mildly, not to mention completely worthless on Android. You can't do anything with the app if you can't download anything to it.
Greatest experience as well as a result of a good time and consideration and look forward to seeing him and hearing him
Everytime I try to use this app, it gives me a downloading error. My family and I have been trying to get this one cache and we cannot because of this app. Please fix

The interface to get started is not intuitive, but in the end, I got the cartridges loaded. However, for some reason, the longitude is displaying in south and latitude in north, putting me 30000km from the cache. I think that would put me somewhere in high earth orbit. Make an app that can read GPS before going past the basics.
Received Download error when I attempted to download a cartridge. Tried to do "workarounds " with no success.
Terrible. Doesn't load anything.
Don't download... All you get is errors

I've been geocaching for over 5 years now and have repeatedly tried to use this app on various different Android phones during that time but I have never been able to get a cartridge to download. It's incredibly frustrating and really shouldn't be this difficult.

I also get the download:error message. To work around it, I manually downloaded the cartridge from the wherigo website, and then manually moved it to the apps default directory. This is my first ever attempt at a Wherigo... exhausted just from getting the cartridge installed
Pull down menus are in black and illegible. When I tried downloading cartridges from the cache page and Whereigo site, I got a download error message. Deleting this app.
Won't load cartridges. Download error every time.. Uninstalling

I have a Galaxy S10e and I can't even get this app to work. I keep getting download error everytime I try to download a wherigo. And the website keeps crashing everytime I try to download off that too. I would love to be able to find Wherigos, FIX THE PROBLEM.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: It sounds like a problem with your account on wherigo.com for which we cannot help, as we do not run the website. Once you get your login to wherigo.com working, download of cartridges with WhereYouGo should also work.

google_play_reviews.content: Map freezes and will not display wherigos outside my immediate area. Uninstalled and reinstalled, still doesn't work.
Found out it only likes certain browsers. Firefox, now downloading cartridges okay! *How do I choose a cartridge from INSIDE the app?*
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Download from within the app is possible. You need to provide your website credentials in the app settings. Afterwards it can automatically download cartridges once you open a link to a cartridge page.

google_play_reviews.content: Everything worked so far
Where is the submit button for you credentials?? Also, this app won't open cartriges despite them being in the right folder, renamed and with the .gwc file extension.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You do not need to submit your credentials. They are just stored locally after providing them in the related menu.

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent

Trying to make this work with the whereigos from the geocaching app, but everytime I try to download the cartridge it says I need to login. So I enter my information and nothing happens, there is no button to submit my login credentials!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You do not need to submit your credentials. Just enter them in the app settings and they will be kept for the next downloads.

google_play_reviews.content: I love playing whereigo caches, but right now there is a problem with the app. When ever I try to get into all the options, like the map, locations etc. The app crashes. Every. Single. Time. Again, I love playing whereigos, but this problem makes it impossible. I have an XT1710-02 running Android 8.0. if any other information is requested (about my phone), I would be happy to provide. Plz fix
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We have recently fixed this problem on Android 8 devices. Please update your installation.

google_play_reviews.content: Thank you, thank you, thank you. I just did an update for the app and it appears to now be working. I loaded 3 WIG cartridges and they loaded seamlessly.

Thank you so much guys for fixing this. Love doing wherigos but haven't been able to for several months due to the issues with downloading them to my android phone. Have uninstalled the old version and reinstalled the new one and everything is working fine again. Thank you :)
The recent faults are fixed, and the future looks good now the app is being maintained
Just isn't working on my new phone
App continuously crashes since the last update.

google_play_reviews.content: Down loaded this app when the Garmin 400t wouldn't work. Just tried it in Funchal and it worked great with no problems on the Samsung galaxy S7.

Haven't had a single problem with this app on my Samsung Galaxy S6. It has performed flawlessly for every WIG I have done. However, I have noticed that if the screen saver activates during use, then the app sometimes freezes. Remedy: turn off the screen saver or set it to a high timeout value, and don't let it turn off the screen. Maybe this could be the reason to the problems many seem to have with this app. I think it would be a good idea if the app had an option to keep the screen active all the time while it is being used.
Installed this app for use with Geocaching Wherigo type caches. Easy to install and loaded the cartridges without any problems and they worked straight away.
